title-group.article-title: True Matters Concealed: Utopia, Desire, and Enlightenment in Honglou meng

abstract.p: The inevitable collapse of the Utopian world of Daguanyuan (大观园) in The Dream of the Red Chamber (红楼梦) paradoxically facilitates Bao-yu's enlightenment, and therefore helps him move from a spatial Utopia to a mental one informed by Chinese Buddhist epistemology.
